intro: Harrisella amesiana, commonly known as the Amesian bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibacillaceae. It is characterized by its tiny, bladder-like structures called bladders, which are used to trap microscopic organisms. This plant typically grows in shallow, freshwater environments such as ponds and wetlands. Its morphology includes slender, branching stems and small, scale-like leaves. Harrisella amesiana plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by contributing to nutrient cycling and providing habitat for microorganisms.
